sen.j: 乙訓寺（おとくにでら）は京都府長岡京市にある真言宗豊山派の寺院。
sen.e: Otokuni-dera Templeis a Buddhist temple belonging to the Buzan branch of the Shingon Sect located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Otokuni-dera Templeis a Buddhist temple belonging to the Buzan branch of the Shingon Sect located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Otokuni-dera Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Buzan school of the Shingon Sect located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: ボタン (植物)の寺として知られる。
sen.e: It is also known as "Botan no Tera" (Peony Temple).
It is also known as "Botan no Tera" (Peony Temple).
It is also known as Botan no Tera (Peony Temple).

sen.j: 寺伝では推古天皇の勅命により聖徳太子が建立したと言われている古刹である。
sen.e: According to temple legend, Otokuni-dera Temple is an ancient temple that was founded by Prince Shotoku under the order of Emperor Suiko.
According to temple legend, Otokuni-dera Temple is an ancient temple that was founded by Prince Shotoku under the order of Emperor Suiko.
According to temple legend, Otokuni-dera Temple is an ancient temple that was founded by the Prince Shotoku under the order of the Emperor Suiko.

sen.j: 創建の正確な事情や時期は未詳であるが、境内出土の瓦の年代から、長岡京造営以前、奈良時代の創建と推定されている。
sen.e: The precise time and circumstances of the temple's founding are unclear but roof tiles excavated within the precinct have led to estimates placing its founding to the Nara period prior to the establishment of the capital city of Nagaoka-kyo.

The precise time and circumstances of the temple's founding are unclear but roof tiles excavated within the precinct have led to estimates placing its founding to the Nara period prior to the establishment of the capital city of Nagaoka-kyo.

The precise time and circumstances of the temple's founding are unclear but roof tiles excavated within the precinct have led to estimates placing its founding to the Nara period prior to the establishment of the capital city of Nagaoka-kyo.

sen.j: 延暦3年（784年）桓武天皇が長岡京を造営した際には都の地鎮として大規模に増築されている。
sen.e: After Emperor Komu established the capital city in Nagaoka-kyo in the year 784, Otokuni-dera Temple was expanded to a large size as the guardian of the capital.
After Emperor Komu established the capital city in Nagaoka-kyo in the year 784, Otokuni-dera Temple was expanded to a large size as the guardian of the capital.
After the Emperor Kanmu established the capital city in Nagaoka-kyo in the year 784, Otokuni-dera Temple was expanded to a large size as the guardian of the capital.
sen.cmt: 人名修正"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: また藤原種継暗殺事件の首謀者の嫌疑をかけられた早良親王が幽閉された場所でもあるとされ、空海が一時住したともいわれる。
sen.e: The temple is believed to have been the place in which Imperial Prince Sawara was confined after becoming suspected as being the mastermind of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu's assassination and Kukai is also said to have briefly resided here.

The temple is believed to have been the place in which Imperial Prince Sawara was confined after becoming suspected as being the mastermind of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu's assassination and Kukai is also said to have briefly resided here.

The temple is believed to have been the place in which Imperial Prince Sawara was confined after becoming suspected as being the mastermind of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu's assassination and Kukai is also said to have briefly resided here.

sen.j: 長岡京が廃都となっても大規模な伽藍を擁し室町時代でも10を越す僧坊があったという。
sen.e: The temple maintained a large complex even after the abolishment of Nagaoka-kyo as capital city and it is reputed to have had in excess of 10 priests' living quarters during the Momoyama period.
The temple maintained a large complex even after the abolishment of Nagaoka-kyo as capital city and it is reputed to have had in excess of 10 priests' living quarters during the Momoyama period.
The temple maintained a large complex even after the abolishment of Nagaoka-kyo as capital city and it is reputed to have had in excess of 10 priests' living quarters during the Momoyama period.

sen.j: （事実、隣接する長岡京市立長岡第三小学校の大部分は学校建設前は寺の敷地であった。）
sen.e: In fact, before the construction of the neighboring Nagaokakyo Municpal Nagaoka Dai-san Elementary School, most of the land on which it stands belonged to the temple.
In fact, before the construction of the neighboring Nagaokakyo Municpal Nagaoka Dai-san Elementary School, most of the land on which it stands belonged to the temple.
(In fact, before the construction of the neighboring Nagaokakyo Municipal Nagaoka Dai-san Elementary School, most of the land on which it stands belonged to the temple.)
sen.cmt: スペル原文に合わせて（）追加

sen.j: 今でこそ牡丹の寺として有名であるが牡丹を植生する前の往年は寂しい佇まいの寺であった。
sen.e: The temple has only recently become famous as the peony temple but it was once a bleak sight.
The temple has only recently become famous as the peony temple but it was once a bleak sight.
The temple has only recently become famous as the peony temple but it was once a bleak sight.

sen.j: 現在、豊山派総本山である長谷寺より2,000株の牡丹が移植されている。
sen.e: There now grow 2,000 peony plants which were moved from Hase-dera Temple, the Buzan branch Grand Head Temple.
There now grow 2,000 peony plants which were moved from Hase-dera Temple, the Buzan branch Grand Head Temple.
There now grow 2,000 peony plants which were moved from Hase-dera Temple, the Buzan school Grand Head Temple.

sen.j: 見頃は4月下旬より5月上旬。
sen.e: These flowers are best viewed from late April from early May.
These flowers are best viewed from late April from early May.
These flowers are best viewed from late April to early May.

sen.j: 木造毘沙門天立像 - 平安時代後期

sen.j: 阪急電鉄京都本線長岡天神駅より徒歩15分またはバス
sen.e: Walk for 15 minutes or take a bus from Nagaoka Tenjin Station on the Hankyu Railways Kyoto Main Line.
Walk for 15 minutes or take a bus from Nagaoka Tenjin Station on the Hankyu Railways Kyoto Main Line.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道東海道本線（JR京都線）長岡京駅より徒歩40分またはバス
sen.e: Walk for 40 minutes or take a bus from Nagaokakyo Station on the JR West Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line).
